importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, October 18, 2025, is relevant because it marks the day the announcement of Ange Postecoglou's dismissal from Nottingham Forest was made, signaling a significant turning point in the club's managerial history.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The 39-day tenure of Ange Postecoglou at Nottingham Forest is the shortest in Premier League history, making this timeframe a critical point in the evolution of managerial tenures in English football.

keyTakeAways: Ange Postecoglou, the Australian football manager, was dismissed by Nottingham Forest after just 39 days in charge, following a 3-0 loss to Chelsea.
Postecoglou failed to win any of his matches during his tenure, with only two draws and six losses.
This dismissal marks the fastest managerial departure in Premier League history, according to Opta, making it a notable record in football management.
The departure follows the exit of Nuno Espírito Santo, who had led the team to its best league finish in 30 years.
Postecoglou's dismissal occurred after he expressed concerns about his relationship with club owner Evangelos Marinakis, which may have contributed to the decision.
The club is now seeking its third manager of the season, highlighting instability in leadership at the time of reporting.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ange Postecoglou, the Australian football manager, was sacked by Nottingham Forest after only 39 days in charge, following a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea. He failed to win a single match during his tenure, drawing two and losing six, marking the shortest managerial stint in Premier League history. His dismissal, which occurred just days after expressing concerns about his relationship with club owner Evangelos Marinakis, has left the club in search of a third manager of the season, highlighting instability following the departure of previous manager Nuno Espírito Santo, who had led the club to its best league finish in 30 years.
title: Nottingham Forest manager Ange Postecoglou fired after just 39 days at Premier League club
